meanings.definition: A self-propelled underwater missile designed to be fired from a ship or submarine
meanings.sent1: The navy used torpedos to protect their ships from enemy submarines.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the launch of torpedos to defend the naval fleet.
meanings.sent3: The torpedos glided gracefully through the water, ready to strike at any moment.
meanings.sent4: The torpedos were like silent hunters, seeking out their targets with precision.
meanings.sent5: The torpedos' sleek design made them a formidable weapon in naval warfare.

meanings.definition: To attack or sink with a torpedo
meanings.sent1: The submarine planned to torpedos the enemy battleship during the night.
meanings.sent2: The navy decided to torpedos the enemy fleet to gain a strategic advantage.
meanings.sent3: The captain joked that he would torpedos his way through the enemy ships.
meanings.sent4: The torpedos of truth would soon sink the lies of the enemy.
meanings.sent5: He torpedosed his way through the competition, emerging victorious in the end.

meanings.definition: A small firework that explodes with a loud noise
meanings.sent1: The children were excited to set off torpedos during the Fourth of July celebrations.
meanings.sent2: The torpedos lit up the night sky with colorful bursts of light.
meanings.sent3: The torpedos startled the birds perched on the nearby trees.
meanings.sent4: The torpedos added a festive touch to the evening with their loud bangs.
meanings.sent5: The torpedos' bright sparks brought joy to everyone watching the fireworks display.
